framework_context.description: Cognitive Strategies is a specific domain within the broader framework of Practical Wisdom. It focuses on the methods and techniques used by humans to solve problems and make decisions, integrating theoretical understanding from Cognitive Science and practical application from Philosophy of Science.

key_concepts.name: Attention Management
key_concepts.explanation: The ability to focus on relevant information while ignoring irrelevant details, essential for effective problem-solving.

key_concepts.name: Memory Techniques
key_concepts.explanation: Methods to enhance memory retention and recall, crucial for learning and decision-making processes.

key_concepts.name: Heuristics
key_concepts.explanation: Rules of thumb or mental shortcuts that help in making decisions under uncertainty, often derived from cognitive biases.

major_principles.name: Efficient Information Processing
major_principles.description: The principle that cognitive strategies should optimize the use of mental resources to achieve goals efficiently.

major_principles.name: Adaptability
major_principles.description: The ability to adjust cognitive strategies based on changing contexts and new information.

major_principles.name: Feedback Loop
major_principles.description: The continuous cycle of applying strategies, evaluating outcomes, and refining techniques to improve performance.

relationships.connection: Cognitive Strategies are essential for effective problem-solving by providing tools and techniques to navigate complex situations.
Cognitive Strategies draw heavily from cognitive science, leveraging insights into perception, attention, memory, and learning to develop practical methods.
Cognitive Strategies integrate theoretical knowledge with practical experience, enabling individuals to apply wisdom in real-world contexts.

implications.description: The study of cognitive strategies has significant implications for knowledge organization by highlighting the importance of interdisciplinary approaches. It demonstrates how abstract principles from epistemology and ontology can be applied in concrete fields like cognitive science and practical wisdom.
